column1: Ragnir was a servant of the Lady Morwen.  When Morwen informed her young son Túrin that it was time for him to leave Dor-lómin he objected
column2: and part of his objection was that his mother would be left with only old women and two male servants
column3: Sador who was lame and Ragnir who was blind.  Nevertheless
column4: Túrin did leave in fulfillment of his mothers command.

column1: When Húrin returned to Dor-lómin many years later he picked up a small party of followers who went with him over the mountains and into the wild.  One companion was also named Ragnir
column2: but he was almost certainly not the same person as blind Ragnir the servant.
